name: Final Game Not Not Prototype
description:
Controller: if you are blessed with this then the wee prototype look somewhat less awkward
Press A to jump and B to Dash, and hold down to crouch
Keyboard: controls are a lot more clunky cause I've just been working solely with my controller but I'll change that in a later build
Space to jump, Shift to dash, WASD and arrow keys to move

REFRESH THE PAGE TO RESTART I'M SORRY

Hey, if you are reading this then I'm sorry that you're playing my mess of a game the now but aye at this very moment I'm thinking of adding platforms that react to the right joystick of the player (this is primarily a controller game but there is keyboard functionality) I'm putting this build here because this is before any major mechanics have been added so it is somewhat like a checkpoint?

I haven't necessarily done much but I wanted to have a player that feels nice to play with while holding a controller and worked from there. I'm taking a few elements from Fungi and Bongoes in terms of style but hopefully, this will turn out decent :)

There will be spikes and mobs in the next few builds and you can already see the spikes when initially spawn in, I haven't added a collision event to the player yet thus you know the spikes don't really do anything right now.

I have to thank Tarodev for their  2D Player Controller that modified a wee bit for the project. Here's their itch: https://tarodev.itch.io/ 
(The audio is also a default from their controller and will not be the same later on)

FOR THE ASSETS, I need to thank 9E0 for the player sprite that I recoloured, here's a link to their itch that has some more of their work: https://9e0.itch.io/

The tilesets and background were done by Quintino and are open-source and free to download, they have many other nice pixel-work to look at and their itch is: https://quintino-pixels.itch.io/
